snippet: Rodgers and Hart before Hollywood, a photographic album of deserted New York City spaces and two studies of neighborhood transformation in Lower Manhattan.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books We'll Have Manhattan: The Early Work of Rodgers & Hart by Dominic Symonds, Upscaling Downtown: From Bowery Saloons to Cocktail Bars in New York City by Richard E Ocejo, New York's New Edge: Contemporary Art, The High Line, and Urban Megaprojects on the Far West Side by David Halle and Elisabeth Tiso and Abandoned NYC by Will Ellis.
lead_paragraph: Rodgers and Hart before Hollywood, a photographic album of deserted New York City spaces and two studies of neighborhood transformation in Lower Manhattan.

headline.main: Early Rodgers and Hart, an Album of New York City Blight, and Two Looks at Gentrification
